Name: Accra
Description: Accra is the capital city of Ghana.

Name: Cape Coast
Description: Cape Coast is a city in the Coastal Plain region of Ghana. Its a 2 hour 15 minutes (144.2km) drive from the capital city, Accra.

Name: Koforidua
Description: Koforidua is a city and capital of Eastern Region in south of Ghana. Koforidua has a settlement population of 127,334 people in 2012.

Name: Kumasi
Description: Kumasi is the main city of Ashanti-Kwahu region of Ghana.

Name: Obuasi
Description: Obuasi is a mining town situated in the Ashanti-Kwahu region of Ghana, some 60 km south of Kumasi.

Name: Sekondi-Takoradi
Description: Sekondi and Takoradi are adjacent port cities; the combined municipality forms the capital of Western Ghana.

Name: Sunyani
Description: Sunyani is the regional capital of the Brong-Ahafo region.

Name: Tamale
Description: Tamale is Ghana's third city and the capital of Northern Ghana. It is the second largest and the third most populous city in Ghana. Tamale has been voted three consecutive times by the Ghana Tourist Board as the cleanest city in Ghana and is proud of its well organized road networking in comparison to other cities and regions through Ghana. The city is like a conglomeration of villages where one can find an architectural blend of traditional mud houses and modern buildings. While the majority of the houses are roofed with corrugated iron sheets, a good number of them are roofed with grass. Many of these mud block compounds have TV antennae and electricity wires.

Name: Tema
Description: Tema is a city on the Ghanaian Coastal Plain. It is 25 kilometres east of Accra, and had a population of 161,612 in 2013. It is the second-largest city in the Greater Accra Region after Accra. It is also the industrial hub of Ghana as well the home to the country's largest port in Tema Harbour.

Name: Boti Falls
Description: Koforidua is a city and capital of Eastern Region in south of Ghana. Koforidua has a settlement population of 127,334 people in 2012.

Name: Kakum National Park
Description: Kakum National Park is in the Coastal Plain region, the best preserved region of virgin rainforest in the country. It provides the easiest access to the rainforest along with its famous canopy walkway.

Name: Mole National Park
Description: Mole National Park is the largest and most frequently visited national park in Ghana. It is reasonably well set up to cater for tourists and although it is more expensive than many other parts of Ghana it is well worth a visit.

Name: Paga
Description: Paga is a town in the north of Ghana.
